poem:
Title: "Unsung Melody in Llanelli"

In the half-closed stalls of memory,
the notes of a harsh hymn persist.
Shamed, a jester dances defiantly, draped in fourteen weeks,
bathed in the ink of a name;
Leigh Brookfield, whisper it, even he
compels the tide of inhumanity.

The battle signs of Barton, aged and real,
slickened by this mournful baptism -
Yet courage sings dry, reverberating
in the still, echoing stalls of dignity.
